message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM. 

The paper deals with the problem of 3D human pose estimation from a single RGB image, which is a common problem in computer vision and machine learning. The proposed method involves the use of deep neural networks for 2D and 3D pose estimation, which falls under the category of computer vision (cs.CV). The use of conditional random fields (CRF) for modeling the problem also suggests a machine learning approach, which could fall under the categories of machine learning (cs.LG) or artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also involves the use of prior knowledge and consistency checks, which could fall under the categories of graphics (cs.GR) or multimedia (cs.MM).
